legalese.renderNotation: This document was rendered into XML using software provided to HL7 by Beeler Consulting LLC.
legalese.contactNote: Comments or questions about this document may be may be addressed to:

div1.head: Notes to Readers
div1.p: Welcome to the Administrative Registries domain. This domain currently includes a single Draft Standard for Trial Use (DSTU) for the Real-Time Location System topic being published by the Patient Administration Technical Committee.

div1.head: Acknowledgements
div1.p: The Patient Administration Technical Committee appreciates the contributions of Amit Popat of Epic who provided the detailed requirements for the Real-Time Location System topic.

div1.head: Known Issues
div1.p: The following revisions were made to the Real-Time Location System topic between passing ballot in January 2007 and publication as a Draft Standard for Trial Use. The Technical Steering Committee approved these revisions as editorial changes:

list.item: The Introduction & Scope was revised to clarify the scope of the current publication
A description of requirements was moved from the Introduction & Scope to an Annex to make clear that it is not part of the normative content
The labels in the UML diagrams describing requirements were revised to make them more consistent with terms used in the balloted artifacts

The RMIM diagram (PRRG_RM801001UV) was revised to move the arrow at the end of the entry point association to make it more visible. Per Section 3.5.8 of the Update Co-Chair Handbook "Changes made to graphics" are not substantive.

More fine-grained Application Roles were added as specializations of the application roles published in the ballot in recognition that some applications may not support all of the balloted interactions (see example below). Per Section 3.5.9.2 of the Updated Co-Chair Handbook "Application Roles are not normative. Therefore, changes to Application Roles are not Substantive." This change also required revising the Storyboard Diagrams to reflect the revised sending and receiving application role names for the interactions referenced in the storyboards. Revised Application Roles Example:
Before, the Patient Tracking Tag Location Updated and Device Tracking Tag Location Updated interactions referenced the same sending and receiving application roles -- Tracking Tag Location Informer and Tracking Tag Location Tracker.
Now, the Patient Tracking Tag Location Updated interaction references the Patient Tracking Tag Location Informer and Patient Tracking Tag Location Tracker application roles. The Device Tracking Tag Location Updated interaction references the Device Tracking Tag Location Informer and Device Tracking Tag Location Tracker application roles

div1.head: Overview
div1.div2: Introduction & ScopeThe Registries domain collects HL7 artifacts for administrative registries. It will eventually include registries of identified persons, patients, providers, equipment and service delivery locations.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: The Administrative Registries D-MIM is an elaboration of the HL7 Reference Information Model (RIM) describing the set of classes, attributes and associations required to exchange information between administrative registries and other healthcare applications. Administrative registries include Patient Registries, Identified Person Registries, Provider Registries and Service Delivery Location Registries. The focal classes in the D-MIM are:

list.item:
Patient - A role played by a LivingSubject as a recipient or potential recipient of health care services from a healthcare provider Organization (scoper).
A Patient can be covered by an insurance policy or government program conveyed in an A_Coverage CMET
The LivingSubject who is a Patient of one Organization may also be the the PatientOfOtherProvider who is responsible for some specified aspect of the patient's care, i.e., a principal or primary care provider.

Health Care Provider - A role played by a Person who is authorized to provide health care services by some authorizing agency (scoper). Provider Registries are currently defined in the Personnel Management domain. The class is included here to support Real Time Location System messages.
Id Tag - A role played by a real time location system tracking tag that is currently in the possession of a holder (patient, provider or device).
Identified Entity - A role played by a Person, NonPersonLivingSubject or Device that is identified by an Organization (scoper). This is the basis for Identified Person registries.

Living Subject - An entity that is or was alive such as a Person, an animal or a plant. These classes contain "administrative" attributes of interest to health care.
Personal Relationship is another living subject related to the focal living subject such as parent, sibling, spouse, neighbor
Care Giver is a living subject who provides primary care for the focal living subject at home
Member is the membership of the focal living subject in a Group such as a family, tribe or religious organization
Agent is a person or organization that is authorized to act on behalf of the focal living subject such as Guardian and Contact.
Guarantor is a person or organization that takes financial responsibility for the health care of the focal living subject
Birth Place is the location where the focal living subject was born or hatched
Other IDs conveys identifiers assigned to the focal living subject in other systems
The Person specialization of Living Subject also includes the following relationships:
Citizen - a relationship between the focal person who owes loyalty to and is entitled by birth or naturalization to the protection of a Nation
Employee - a relationship of the focal person with an organization to receive wages or salary. The purpose of this class is to identify the type of relationship the employee has to the employer rather than the nature of the work actually performed
Student - a relationship of the focal person to a school in which they are enrolled
Language Communication - the language communication capability of the focal person
Identity Document - An identification document that can be the subject of a verification process
Service Delivery Location - A role played by a Place at which services may be provided by an Organization (scoper).

div2.head: Introduction
div2.p: A Real Time Location System (RTLS) captures, processes and stores information about the location of tracking tags associated with resources (patients, providers, equipment) as they move around a healthcare facility.

div3.head: Introduction & Scope
div3.p: The Real Time Location System Topic currently focuses on unsolicited (not request/response) notification messages between Real Time Location Systems (RTLS) and other healthcare systems, such as Electronic Medical Record (EMR) software, patient registration and medical logistics systems, for the purpose of tracking the whereabouts of patients, healthcare providers, and devices used in a healthcare setting. In addition to providing the ability to simply track the location of patients, providers, and devices, this topic also allows for notifications regarding the co-location of patients, providers, and devices (i.e. a patient, provider, and/or device are all in the same location).

The definition of a location instance (i.e. an area in the healthcare facility that is mapped in the Real Time Location System software/hardware) is controlled by the business rules of the implementation and is outside the scope of this specification. Similarly, the definition of what constitutes a location change in the RTLS is defined by the business rules of that system and is therefore outside the scope of this specification.

A Real Time Location System (RTLS) Tracking Tag (or more simply Tracking Tag) is a device that is attached to an entity (such as a patient, provider, or medical device) that is used in conjunction with a Real Time Location System to track the movement of that entity.

div2.div3:
Changes from BallotThe Technical Committee approved a number of technical edits to non-normative content to improve the clarity of the presentation.
The Requirements are moved to the Annex to make clear that they are not part of the normative content.
The UML diagrams in the Requirements section are updated to use the same terms as the final design reflected in the normative content.
The Application Roles (which are not normative) are further specialized by the type of resource being tracked (patient, provider, device). This recognizes that some applications may track only one of those types of resources.

div3.head: Known Issues
div3.p: This Real Time Location System Topic currently focuses on unsolicited (not request/response) notification messages between Real Time Location Systems (RTLS) and other healthcare systems. This specification could be expanded to include a request/response messaging model.

This specification addresses tracking only of patients, providers and equipment. Other resources in the health care setting such as supplies and pharmaceuticals are tracked by some logistical systems.
The Patient Administration Technical Committee invites implementers with additional requirements to submit content proposals for future releases of this standard.

descriptive.name: Reference
descriptive.p: For details on the interpretation of this section, see in the Version 3 Guide.

story.name: Rtls Assign Device Tag Notify
story.descriptive: This storyboard demonstrates notifying a real time location tracking system that a specific tracking tag has been assigned to a specific device.

Tuesday morning the Good Health Hospital receiving department delivered a new portable x-ray machine to the Emergency Department. Ms. Technician fastens tracking tag X-21 to the machine and records that assignment in the Emergency Department administrative system which sends a notification to the real time location tracking system.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Activate Notification Device Tag

story.name: Rtls Assign Patient Tag Notify
story.descriptive: This storyboard demonstrates notifying a real time location tracking system that a specific tracking tag has been assigned to a specific patient.

Adam Everyman arrives at the Good Health Hospital Emergency Room via car. Mr. Everyman has broken his left hand. Christopher Clerk, the emergency room clerk registers and checks in Mr. Everyman and assigns him a unique RTLS tracking device with a tag ID E1124. The EMR system sends a notification to the real time location tracking system associating Mr. Everyman with the tag E1124.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Activate Notification Patient Tag

story.name: Rtls Assign Provider Tag Notify
story.descriptive: This storyboard demonstrates notifying a real time location tracking system that a specific tracking tag has been assigned to a specific healthcare practitioner.

Dr. Eric Emergency is a new physician in the Emergency Department of Good Health Hospital. He is issued a new photo id with embedded tracking tag S4567 and the personnel system initiates a interaction to the real time location tracking system.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Activate Notification Provider Tag

story.name: Rtls Complete Assign Patient Tag Notify
story.familiarName: Tracking Tag Assignment to Patient Ended
story.descriptive: This storyboard demonstrates notifying a real time location tracking system that a specific tracking tag is no longer assigned to a specific patient.

descriptive.name: Rtls Complete Assign Patient Tag Notify
descriptive.familiarName: Tracking Tag Assignment to Patient Ended

story.descriptive: Adam Everyman was treated for his broken hand and Dr. Eric Emergency thinks he is ready to go home and recover. Mr. Everyman proceeds to the registration desk where Christopher Clerk completes Mr. Everyman's discharge and takes the RTLS tracking device that was assigned to him. The EMR system sends a notification to the real time location tracking system ending the association of Mr. Everyman with tag E1124.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Complete Notification Patient Tag

story.name: Rtls Locate Device Notify
story.descriptive: This storyboard demonstrates a real time location tracking system notifying other systems that a particular device has moved to a new valid location.

Dr. Emergency looks at Mr. Everyman's hand and suspects some bones are broken so he calls for an x-ray. The x-ray technician, Ms. Tina Technician, brings the portable x-ray machine to room 12A. The real time location system notes that the x-ray machine has moved and initiates a notification.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Notification Observe Device Tag Location

story.name: Rtls Locate Patient Notify
story.descriptive: This storyboard demonstrates a real time location tracking system notifying other systems that a particular patient has moved to a new valid location.

Mr. Everyman is checked into the Emergency Department and issued an RTLS tracking tag. He is then escorted to room 12A where he waits for the physician on duty, Dr. Eric Emergency. The real time location system notes Mr. Everyman's new location and initiates a notification to the EMR.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Notification Observe Patient Location

story.name: Rtls Locate Provider Notify
story.descriptive: This storyboard demonstrates a real time location tracking system notifying other systems that a particular healthcare practitioner has moved to a new valid location.
Dr. Emergency walks into Mr. Everyman's room and checks Mr. Everyman's hand. The real time location tracking system notes Dr. Emergency has moved to room 12A and initiates a notification.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Notification Observe Provider Tag Location

story.name: Rtls Patient And Provider Co-located Notify
story.descriptive: This storyboard demonstrates a real time location tracking system notifying other systems that a particular patient and a particular healthcare practitioner are in the same location.

descriptive.name: Rtls Patient And Provider Co-located Notify

story.descriptive: Dr. Eric Emergency walks into Mr. Everyman's room and checks Mr. Everyman's hand. The real time location system notes Dr. Emergency's new location and initiates a notification to the EMR. The RTLS also computes that the tracking tags for Mr. Everyman and Dr. Emergency are located within the same service delivery location and initiates a interaction to the EMR. Dr. Emergency suspects that Mr. Everyman's hand is broken. He calls for the x-ray technician, Ms. Tina Technician.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Notification Observe Provider Tag Location
Rtls Event Notification Observe Co-located Patient Provider

story.name: Rtls Patient Provider Device Co-located Notify
story.descriptive: This storyboard demonstrates a real time location tracking system notifying other systems that a particular patient, a particular healthcare practitioner and a particular device are all in the same location.

descriptive.name: Rtls Patient Provider Device Co-located Notify

story.descriptive: Ms. Technician brings along the portable x-ray machine with her to Mr. Everyman's room and performs the x-ray on his hand. The real time location tracking system initiates a notification after Ms Technician moves to room 12A and a interaction after the x-ray machine is moved to room 12A. The system then notes that Ms. Technician, the x-ray machine and Mr. Everyman are in room 12A together and initiates a notification.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Notification Observe Provider Tag Location
Rtls Event Notification Observe Device Tag Location
Rtls Event Notification Observe Co-located Patient Provider Device

trigger.name: Rtls Event Activate Register Tag Notification
trigger.descriptive: This trigger event signals that a tracking tag has been assigned to a particular resource (patient, provider or device).

intref.refName: Rtls Event Activate Notification Patient Tag
Rtls Event Activate Notification Provider Tag
Rtls Event Activate Notification Device Tag

trigger.name: Rtls Event Complete Observe Patient And Provider Tags Co-located Notification

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This trigger event signals that a patient and provider are now in the same location. Locally defined business rules determine which locations are of interest and how long the tracked resources need to be in that location to initiate this trigger event.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Notification Observe Co-located Patient Provider

trigger.name: Rtls Event Complete Observe Patient Provider Device Tags Co-located Notification

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This trigger event signals that a patient, a provider and a piece of equipment are now in the same location. Locally defined business rules determine which locations are of interest and how long the tracked resources need to be in that location to initiate this trigger event.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Notification Observe Co-located Patient Provider Device

trigger.name: Rtls Event Complete Observe Tag Location Notification

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This trigger event signals that a tracking tag has moved to a new location. Locally defined business rules determine which locations are of interest and how long the tracked resource needs to be in that location to initiate this trigger event.

intref.refName: Rtls Event Complete Notification Patient Tag
Rtls Event Complete Notification Provider Tag
Rtls Event Complete Notification Device Tag

descriptive.name: Reference
descriptive.p: For details on the interpretation of this section, see in the Version 3 Guide.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: The Tag Assignment information model defines the payload message used when informing systems about the assignment of a real time location tracking tag to a resource playing the role of patient, provider or device.

The entry point to this payload message is the IdTag role played by a physical tracking tag (ManufacturedMaterial) that is Held by a particular Person, NonPersonLivingSubject, or Device. A Person holding the IdTag must play the role of an identified HealthCareProvider or an identified Patient. A NonPersonLivingSubject holding the IdTag must play the role of an identified Patient.
The specifics of the assignment action are conveyed in the Master File / Reg Event Notification Control Act (MFMI_RM700700UV) control act:

list.item: Assign a tracking tag to a resource -- the RegistrationEvent.statusCode is set to active and the starting time of the RegistrationEvent.effectiveTime interval is populated.
End assignment of a tracking tag to a resource -- the RegistrationEvent.statusCode is set to completed and the ending time of the RegistrationEvent.effectiveTime interval is populated.
Cancel an erroneously reported assignment of a tracking tag to a resource -- the RegistrationEvent.statusCode is set to nullified .

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: The Tag Location information model defines the payload message used when informing systems about the location of a real time location tracking tag assigned to a patient, provider or device.

The entry point to this payload message is the PositionObservationEvent representing the act of observing the position of a tracking tag. The required statusCode attribute conveys the status of the observation event; the default value is completed. The required effectiveTime attribute is the time the tracking tag was observed at the reported location. The priorityCode conveys the relative urgency for reporting this location observation. The confidentialityCode contains values that control disclosure of this location observation.
The PositionObservationEvent has a mandatory location association to exactly one LocationRole.

The PositionObservationEvent has a mandatory subject association to exactly one IdTag which has an optional association to the Person, NonPersonLivingSubject, or Device holding the tag. A Person can be identified as either a Patient or a HealthCareProvider. A NonPersonLivingSubject can be identified as a Patient.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: The Co-Located Tags information model defines the payload message used when informing systems that two or more real time location tracking tags are in close proximity to one another.

The entry point to this payload message is the PositionObservationEvent representing the act of observing the position of the tracking tags. The required statusCode attribute conveys the status of the observation event; the default value is completed. The required effectiveTime attribute is the time the tracking tags were observed at the reported location. The priorityCode conveys the relative urgency for reporting this location observation. The confidentialityCode contains values that control disclosure of this location observation.
The PositionObservationEvent has a mandatory location association to exactly one LocationRole.

The PositionObservationEvent has a mandatory subject association to two or more IdTags each which has an optional association to the Person, NonPersonLivingSubject, or Device holding the tag. A Person can be identified as either a Patient or a HealthCareProvider. A NonPersonLivingSubject can be identified as a Patient..

descriptive.name: Reference
descriptive.p: For details on the interpretation of this section, see in the Version 3 Guide.

hmd.name: Rtls Event Assign Tag
hmd.descriptive: This HMD defines the payload message used when informing systems about the assignment of a real time location tracking tag to a resource (patient, provider or device).

hmd.name: Rtls Event Observe Tag Location
hmd.descriptive: This HMD defines the payload message used when informing systems about the location of a real time location tracking tag assigned to a resource (patient, provider or device).

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This HMD defines the payload message used when informing systems that two or more real time location tracking tags are in close proximity to one another.

interaction.name: Rtls Event Activate Notification Device Tag
interaction.descriptive:
This notification is sent from an EMR or medical logistics system to a real time location tracking system to convey that a specific tracking tag has been assigned to a specific piece of equipment.
In this interaction the IdTag is scoped by the Device class in the Choice box in the Tag Assignment (PRRG_MT801001UV) payload and the RegistrationEvent statusCode is set to active in the Master File / Reg Notif. Control Act, Role Subject (MFMI_MT700701UV) control act.

arref.refName: Rtls Event Existence Informer Device Assignment
Rtls Event Existence Tracker Device Assignment

teref.refName: Rtls Event Activate Register Tag Notification

msgref.refName: Master File / Reg Notif. Control Act, Role Subject

interaction.name: Rtls Event Activate Notification Patient Tag
interaction.descriptive:
This notification is sent from an EMR or registration system to a real time location tracking system to convey that a specific tracking tag has been assigned to a specific patient.
In this interaction the IdTag is scoped by either Person or NonPersonLivingSubject in the LivingSubjectChoice box playing the role of Patient in the Tag Assignment (PRRG_MT801001UV) payload and the RegistrationEvent statusCode is set to active in the Master File / Reg Notif. Control Act, Role Subject (MFMI_MT700701UV) control act.

arref.refName: Rtls Event Existence Informer Patient Assignment
Rtls Event Existence Tracker Patient Assignment

msgref.refName: Master File / Reg Notif. Control Act, Role Subject

interaction.name: Rtls Event Activate Notification Provider Tag
interaction.descriptive:
This notification is sent from an EMR or registration system to a real time location tracking system to convey that a specific tracking tag has been assigned to a specific healthcare practitioner.
In this interaction the IdTag is scoped by Person in the Choice box playing the role of HealthCareProvider in the Tag Assignment (PRRG_MT801001UV) payload and the RegistrationEvent statusCode is set to active in the Master File / Reg Notif. Control Act, Role Subject (MFMI_MT700701UV) control act.

arref.refName: Rtls Event Existence Informer Provider Assignment

interaction.name: Rtls Event Complete Notification Device Tag

This notification is sent from an EMR or medical logistics system to a real time location tracking system to convey that a specific tracking tag is no longer assigned to a specific piece of equipment.
In this interaction the RegistrationEvent statusCode is set to completed in the Master File / Reg Notif. Control Act, Role Subject (MFMI_MT700701UV) control act.

arref.refName: Rtls Event Existence Informer Device Assignment
Rtls Event Existence Tracker Device Assignment

teref.refName: Rtls Event Complete Register Tag Notification

msgref.refName: Master File / Reg Notif. Control Act, Role Subject

interaction.name: Rtls Event Complete Notification Patient Tag
interaction.descriptive:
This notification is sent from an EMR or registration system to a real time location tracking system to convey that a specific tracking tag is no longer assigned to a specific patient.
In this interaction the RegistrationEvent statusCode is set to completed in the Master File / Reg Notif. Control Act, Role Subject (MFMI_MT700701UV) control act.

arref.refName: Rtls Event Existence Informer Patient Assignment
Rtls Event Existence Tracker Patient Assignment

teref.refName: Rtls Event Complete Register Tag Notification

msgref.refName: Master File / Reg Notif. Control Act, Role Subject

interaction.name: Rtls Event Complete Notification Provider Tag
interaction.descriptive:
This notification is sent from an EMR or registration system to a real time location tracking system to convey that a specific tracking tag is no longer assigned to a specific provider.
In this interaction the RegistrationEvent statusCode is set to completed in the Master File / Reg Notif. Control Act, Role Subject (MFMI_MT700701UV) control act.

arref.refName: Rtls Event Existence Informer Provider Assignment
Rtls Event Existence Tracker Provider Assignment

teref.refName: Rtls Event Complete Register Tag Notification

msgref.refName: Master File / Reg Notif. Control Act, Role Subject

interaction.name: Rtls Event Notification Observe Co-located Patient Provider Device

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This notification is sent from a real time location tracking system to convey that a patient, a provider and a device are now in the same location. Locally defined business rules determine which locations are of interest and how long the resources need to be in that location to trigger this interaction.

In this interaction the PositionObservationEvent has three subject participations -- one to Device, one to Person playing the role of HealthCareProvider and one to LivingSubjectChoice with either Person or NonPersonLivingSubject playing the role of Patient.

arref.refName: Rtls Event Completion Informer Colocate Patient Provider Device
arref.refFamiliarName: Patient Provider Device Co-Located Tag Informer

arref.refName: Rtls Event Completion Tracker Colocate Patient Provider Device
arref.refFamiliarName: Patient Provider Device Co-Located Tag Tracker

teref.refName: Rtls Event Complete Observe Patient Provider Device Tags Co-located Notification

interaction.name: Rtls Event Notification Observe Co-located Patient Provider
interaction.descriptive:
This notification is sent from a real time location tracking system to convey that a patient and a provider are now in the same location. Locally defined business rules determine which locations are of interest and how long the resources need to be in that location to trigger this interaction.
In this interaction the PositionObservationEvent has two subject participations -- one to Person playing the role of HealthCareProvider and one to LivingSubjectChoice with either Person or NonPersonLivingSubject playing the role of Patient.

arref.refName: Rtls Event Completion Informer Colocate Patient Provider
Rtls Event Completion Tracker Colocate Patient Provider

teref.refName: Rtls Event Complete Observe Patient And Provider Tags Co-located Notification

interaction.name: Rtls Event Notification Observe Device Tag Location
interaction.descriptive:
This notification is sent from a real time location tracking system to convey that a tracked device has moved to a different location. Locally defined business rules determine which locations are of interest and how long the tracked resource needs to be in that location to trigger this interaction.
In this interaction the IdTag would be scoped by the Device class in the Choice box.

arref.refName: Rtls Event Completion Informer Locate Device
Rtls Event Completion Tracker Locate Device

teref.refName: Rtls Event Complete Observe Tag Location Notification

interaction.name: Rtls Event Notification Observe Patient Location
interaction.descriptive:
This notification is sent from a real time location tracking system to convey that a tracked patient has moved to a different location. Locally defined business rules determine which locations are of interest and how long the tracked resource needs to be in that location to trigger this interaction.
In this interaction the IdTag would be scoped by either Person or NonPersonLivingSubject in the LivingSubjectChoice box playing the role of Patient.

arref.refName: Rtls Event Completion Informer Locate Patient
Rtls Event Completion Tracker Locate Patient

teref.refName: Rtls Event Complete Observe Tag Location Notification

interaction.name: Rtls Event Notification Observe Provider Tag Location
interaction.descriptive:
This notification is sent from a real time location tracking system to convey that a tracked healthcare practitioner has moved to a different location. Locally defined business rules determine which locations are of interest and how long the tracked resource needs to be in that location to trigger this interaction.
In this interaction the IdTag would be scoped by Person in the Choice box playing the role of HealthCareProvider.

arref.refName: Rtls Event Completion Informer Locate Provider
Rtls Event Completion Tracker Locate Provider

teref.refName: Rtls Event Complete Observe Tag Location Notification

div3.head: Introduction & Scope
div3.p: This annex contains the RTLS (real time location system) requirements that informed the design being published as a Draft Standard for Trail Use by the HL7 Patient Administration Technical Committee.

div4.head: Assign RTLS Tracking Tag to a Patient Use Case

list.item: Goal in Context: To have the RTLS tracking tag assigned to the patient in the receiving system
Scope: business
Precondition(s): Both the sending and receiving systems have a record of the RTLS tracking tag and the patient.
Trigger: The person gives the RTLS tracking tag to the patient
Success Guarantee(s): The RTLS tracking tag is assigned to the patient in the receiving system
A person gives the RTLS tracking tag to a patient
A person selects the patient and RTLS tracking tag in the sending system and assigns the RTLS tracking tag to the patient
The sending system sends a message that the RTLS tracking tag has been associated with the patient to the receiving system
The receiving system receives the message, validates it, and processes it (assigning the RTLS tracking tag to the patient)

div4.head: Assign RTLS Tracking Tag to a Provider Use Case

list.item: Goal in Context: To have the RTLS tracking tag assigned to the provider in the receiving system
Scope: business
Precondition(s): Both the sending and receiving systems have a record of the RTLS tracking tag and the provider
Trigger: The person gives the RTLS tracking tag to the provider
Success Guarantee(s): The RTLS tracking tag is assigned to the provider in the receiving system
A person gives the RTLS tracking tag to a provider
A person selects the provider and RTLS tracking tag in the sending system and assigns the RTLS tracking tag to the provider
The sending system sends a message that the RTLS tracking tag has been associated with the provider to the receiving system.
The receiving system receives the message, validates it, and processes it (assigning the RTLS tracking tag to the provider)

div4.head: Assign RTLS Tracking Tag to a Device Use Case

list.item: Goal in Context: To have the RTLS tracking tag assigned to the device in the receiving system
Scope: business
Precondition(s): Both the sending and receiving systems have a record of the RTLS tracking tag and the device
Trigger: The person gives the RTLS tracking tag to the device
Success Guarantee(s): The RTLS tracking tag is assigned to the device in the receiving system
A person attaches the RTLS tracking tag to a device
A person selects the device and RTLS tracking tag in the sending system and assigns the RTLS tracking tag to the device
The sending system sends a message that the RTLS tracking tag has been associated with the device to the receiving system
The receiving system receives the message, validates it, and processes it (assigning the RTLS tracking tag to the device)

div4.head: Patient Tracking Tag Location Updated Use Case

list.item: Goal in Context: To update the patient's location in the receiving system
Scope: business

Precondition(s): Both the sending and receiving systems have a record of the RTLS tracking tag and the patient. Both systems are also aware of the patient previously being assigned the RTLS tracking tag. Both systems have a shared master file of location identifiers.
Trigger: The patient (with the RTLS tracking tag attached) moves to a new location
Success Guarantee(s): The patient's location is updated in the receiving system
A patient with an RTLS tracking tag assigned moves to a new location
The sending system sends a message to the receiving system indicating that the patient's location has been updated
The receiving system receives the message, validates it, and processes it (updating the patient's location)

div4.head: Provider Tracking Tag Location Updated Use Case

list.item: Goal in Context: To update the provider's location in the receiving system
Scope: business

Precondition(s): Both the sending and receiving systems have a record of the RTLS tracking tag and the provider. Both systems are also aware of the provider previously being assigned the RTLS tracking tag. Both systems have a shared master file of location identifiers.
Trigger: The provider (with the RTLS tracking tag attached) moves to a new location
Success Guarantee(s): The provider location is updated in the receiving system
A provider with an RTLS tracking tag assigned moves to a new location
The sending system sends a message to the receiving system indicating that the provider's location has been updated
The receiving system receives the message, validates it, and processes it (updating the provider's location)

div4.head: Device Tracking Tag Location Updated Use Case

list.item: Goal in Context: To update the device's location in the receiving system
Scope: business

Precondition(s): Both the sending and receiving systems have a record of the RTLS tracking tag and the device. Both systems are also aware of the device previously being assigned the RTLS tracking tag. Both systems have a shared master file of location identifiers.
Trigger: The device (with the RTLS tracking tag attached) moves to a new location
Success Guarantee(s): The device location is updated in the receiving system
A device with an RTLS tracking tag assigned moves to a new location
The sending system sends a message to the receiving system indicating that the device's location has been updated
The receiving system receives the message, validates it, and processes it (updating the device's location)

div4.head: Patient and Provider Co-Located Use Case

list.item: Goal in Context: To co-locate the patient and provider in the receiving system
Scope: business

Precondition(s): Both the sending and receiving systems have a record of the RTLS tracking tags, the patient, and provider. Both systems are also aware of the patient and provider previously being assigned RTLS tracking tags. Both systems have a shared master file of location identifiers.
Trigger: The patient and provider (with RTLS tracking tags attached) both move to the same location
Success Guarantee(s): The patient and provider are co-located in the receiving system
A patient and provider with RTLS tracking tags assigned move to the same location
The sending system sends a message to the receiving system indicating that the patient and provider are in the same location (co-located)
The receiving system receives the message, validates it, and processes it (co-locating the patient and provider)

div4.head: Patient, Provider, and Device Co-Locate Use Case

list.item: Goal in Context: To co-locate the patient, provider, and device in the receiving system
Scope: business

Precondition(s): Both the sending and receiving systems have a record of the RTLS tracking tags, the patient, provider, and device. Both systems are also aware of the patient, provider, and device previously being assigned RTLS tracking tags. Both systems have a shared master file of location identifiers.
Trigger: The patient, provider, and device (with RTLS tracking tags attached) all move to the same location
Success Guarantee(s): The patient, provider, and device are co-located in the receiving system
A patient, provider, and device with RTLS tracking tags assigned move to the same location
The sending system sends a message to the receiving system indicating that the patient, provider, and device are in the same location (co-located)
The receiving system receives the message, validates it, and processes it (co-locating the patient, provider, and device)

div3.head: Activity Diagrams
div3.p: The following UML activity diagrams show how the messaging interactions in this standard fit into the real time location tracking system process.

div3.head: State Diagram
div3.p: The following UML state diagram shows how a real time location system tracking tag must be associated with a specific resource (an entity playing the role of patient, provider or device) before it can become the subject of position observations.

div3.head: Sequence Diagram
div3.p: The following UML sequence diagram shows how systems exchange real time location tracking information.
